CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 23, 1960, pg. 2, reads: "POLICE STRAY BULLETS DAMAGE PASTOR'S HOME - When police were chasing a supermarket robber in Homewood Saturday night, two of their bullets narrowly missed Rev. Matthew Burnett (far right photo, holding one of the spent pellets); his wife, Mrs. Alice Burnett, shown in front of the car in bottom right photo; and his son, Holden, 12, in same photo. All three were alighting from car when police fired bullets at the fleeing thug.  One of the bullets went through front porch railing (shown in bottom right and top, center photos) then through screen door, finally hitting the bottom of the bed as outlined in far left photo.  The other bullet wen through the sash of a front window, then through a window shade and landed in wall of the bedroom at upper spot outlined in left photo. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Holden Burnett standing on porch hit by bullets during police chase, at his home, 560 Dunfermline Street, Homewood
